thread.title: Review: When ‘The Marshall Plan’ Helped Plot a New Course for the West

author: Paul Kennedy
title: Review: When ‘The Marshall Plan’ Helped Plot a New Course for the West
text:
‘Our policy is directed not against any country or doctrine, but against hunger, poverty, desperation and chaos.” It is difficult to think of any words delivered at any university commencement that had more historical weight than those spoken in the final minutes of George C. Marshall’s speech at Harvard on June 5, 1947.
The venue was carefully chosen as a dignified but noncontroversial place. The speaker was one of the greatest secretaries of state this country ever produced. The words had been crafted and recrafted by some...
